snippet: Tangible examples of the resulting spending cuts abound five months after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on how to reduce the nation’s debt.
abstract: Much of the federal workforce has been grounded by across-the-board budget cuts known as the sequester, and federal officials say travel restrictions are one of the more tangible examples of the failure by Congress and Pres Obama to reach a compromise on how to reduce the nation's debt; various agency officials say cuts have made government is incapable of conducting essential business and is embarrassing itself abroad.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and RON NIXON

lead_paragraph: Tangible examples of the resulting spending cuts abound five months after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on how to reduce the nation’s debt.

headline.main: U.S. Workers Are Grounded by Deep Cuts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Workers Are Grounded By Deep Cuts
